meanings.definition: The sensation of flavor perceived in the mouth and throat on contact with a substance.
meanings.sent1: The soup had a unique taste that reminded me of home.
meanings.sent2: I love the taste of fresh strawberries in the summer.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at cooking had a taste of disaster.
meanings.sent4: The music had a taste of nostalgia that brought tears to her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The taste of victory was sweet after all the hard work.

meanings.definition: A person's liking for particular flavors.
meanings.sent1: Her taste in music is quite eclectic, ranging from classical to rock.
meanings.sent2: His taste for spicy food always surprises his friends.
meanings.sent3: His taste for adventure led him to explore unknown territories.
meanings.sent4: Her taste for fashion is evident in her stylish outfits.
meanings.sent5: Their taste for art was evident in the way they decorated their home.

meanings.definition: The ability to discern what is of good quality or of a high aesthetic standard.
meanings.sent1: His taste in art is impeccable, always choosing the most exquisite pieces.
meanings.sent2: She has a refined taste in literature, preferring classic novels.
meanings.sent3: Their taste in interior design is so good, it's like they have a magic touch.
meanings.sent4: His taste in music is like a compass, always pointing to the best tunes.
meanings.sent5: The taste for excellence in their work was evident in every detail.
